content.title: Marriage Assistance to Normal Persons Marrying Orthopedically Differently Abled Persons
content.department: Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons
content.beneficiary: Normal persons marrying orthopedically differently abled persons
content.details: The scheme 'Marriage Assistance to Normal Persons Marrying Orthopedically Differently Abled Persons' was launched by the Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled Persons, Government of Tamil Nadu, with the noble objective of supporting and facilitating marriages between normal individuals and orthopedically differently abled persons. This initiative recognizes the importance of inclusivity and equality in relationships, aiming to reduce social barriers and promote harmony within society. By providing financial assistance to normal individuals marrying orthopedically differently abled persons, the scheme seeks to alleviate some of the financial burdens that may arise in such unions, ensuring that all individuals, regardless of physical ability, have the opportunity to experience the joys of marriage.
benefits: Marriage assistance amount: ₹25,000/- as ₹12,500/- National Savings Certificate and ₹12,500/- cheque/Demand Draft for marriage expenses
Additional benefit if either spouse has a degree/diploma: Increased amount to ₹50,000/- as ₹25,000/- National Savings Certificate and ₹25,000/- cheque/Demand Draft
8 gram gold coin for Tirumangalyam (a traditional South Indian symbol of marriage for women)
eligibility: A normal person should marry an orthopedically differently abled person.
The age of the couple (both) should be above 18 years.
The normal person and orthopedically differently abled person individuals holding a degree or diploma are eligible to receive increased assistance.
content.application_process: Offline. The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the District Differently Abled Welfare Office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications. Fill in all mandatory fields, attach copies of all mandatory documents, and submit the application form to the District Differently Abled Welfare Officer. Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the officer.
documents_required: National Identity Card of the Differently abled Bride and Groom
Age Proof of Bride and Groom
Degree or Diploma Certificate of Bride and/or Groom

faqs.question: What is the breakdown of the assistance between National Savings Certificate and cash?
faqs.answer: The assistance is distributed in the form of a National Savings Certificate and as a cheque or Demand Draft.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to receive the marriage assistance?
faqs.answer: Normal individuals marrying orthopedically differently abled persons are eligible to receive the assistance.

faqs.question: Are there any income criteria for eligibility?
faqs.answer: There are no income criteria specified for eligibility under this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the increased assistance amount for those holding a degree or diploma?
faqs.answer: If either the differently abled person or the normal person holds a degree or diploma, the assistance amount is increased to ₹50,000/-.

faqs.question: How long has the scheme been in effect?
faqs.answer: The scheme has been in effect since May 23, 2016.

faqs.question: What is the minimum age requirement for the couple?
faqs.answer: Both individuals in the couple must be above 18 years of age to qualify for the scheme.

faqs.question: Is there any deadline for submitting the application?
faqs.answer: There is no specific deadline mentioned for submitting the application.

faqs.question: Can the assistance be availed multiple times?
faqs.answer: The assistance can typically be availed once per eligible marriage.

faqs.question: Is there any provision for pre-marriage counseling?
faqs.answer: There is no provision mentioned for pre-marriage counseling under this scheme.

faqs.question: Are there any conditions regarding the wedding ceremony?
faqs.answer: There are no specific conditions mentioned regarding the wedding ceremony.
